title: Intensive Short-Term Course on Machine Learning-Based Vibration Neural Network Design: Case Studies for Social Infrastructure Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational electronics, neural network theory, Python programming experience, basic understanding of social infrastructure systems
context.additional_context: Support for smartphone-based mobile learning environments and enhanced practical training via VR simulations. It includes case studies for solving real-world social issues such as urban planning, traffic management, and energy distribution.

learning_goals: Learners explain the fundamental principles of Oscillatory Neural Networks (ONNs) and construct circuit models applicable to social infrastructure monitoring.

Within one week, learners perform practical calculations of coupled resistance values in smart city sensor networks using the Backpropagation Through Time (BPTT) algorithm and derive correct results with over 90% accuracy in at least three urban environmental test cases.

Within one week, learners implement a multilayer Optical Neural Network (ONN) classifier using machine learning-based design, achieve over 75% accuracy on social datasets (e.g., traffic flow, energy consumption), and write an evaluation report using five performance metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, ROC-AUC).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
